questions.question: Hexagon pyramid is placed in such a way its axis is perpendicular to HP and one edge AB parallels to VP and then next this turns about its axis so the base AB is now making some angle with VP. The top view of the previous and later one will be having the same shape.

explanations.a: Correct, the right answer is (a). When the pyramid is rotated about its axis, the spatial orientation of the base changes, but since the rotation is about the axis (which is perpendicular to HP), the top view (projection on HP) remains unaffected. The base (AB) will still appear as a hexagon in the top view, regardless of its angle with VP.

questions.question: cylinder is first placed such that its axis is perpendicular to VP and next this is tilted such that its axis is making some acute angle with VP . The top view for the previous and later one will be _______

explanations.a: The right answer is (c). The front view of a over-encapsulated cylinder will be circle and the top view will be a rectangle with circular ends if it's axis is perpendicular to VP.
